result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan A Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan A Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan A Scott was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions, (for work and treatment), if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Inform any doctors of use of controlled substances.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Sign any releases deemed by Agent.

Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
  DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done..
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, STAYED, for use by Agent.

records.addlTxt: from the State dated 8/25/16 regarding dismissing Count 3.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryan A Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Count 3 dismissed outright.  

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

200 DAYS HUBER w/release for work and treatment (CREDIT - 0 days);

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*30 days jail STAYED for use by Agent
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Obtain employment 
*Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Inform any doctors of use of controlled substances
*Sign any releases deemed necessary by Agent


FINE:  $268.00 - Cash bail to be applied to costs and surcharge.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.
DNA SURCHARGE: $250.00 - Cash bail to be applied to costs and surcharge.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case 15CF410 called for a motion hearing regarding the search.  Cases 15CF562 and 15CM614 called as a hearing.  Defendant Ryan A Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Bradley Condon sworn in, testified. Officer Chelsea Koenen sworn in, testified.  Defendant sworn in, testified.  Testimony closed.  Parties give closing arguments.  Court grants the motion to suppress the evidence in 15CF410.  Attorney Masnica moves to dismiss counts #1 and 2 in case # 15CF410.  Court denies this request.  All cases are set for a plea and sentencing.  Whatever case does not proceed to a pleah will be set for a jury trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
